tit.cmt: (neckpiece on a kimono) を追記しました。

sen.j: 半衿（はんえり）とは、和服用の下着である襦袢に縫い付ける替え衿のこと。
sen.e: "Haneri" means a substitute collar that is sewed on juban, underwear for wafuku (Japanese traditional clothes).
The "haneri" is a detachable neckpieces for kimonos that is sewed on a juban, underwear for wafuku (Japanese traditional clothes).
The "haneri" is a detachable neckpieces for kimonos that is sewed on a juban, underwear for wafuku (Japanese traditional clothes).

sen.j: 名前は、その長さが実際の襟の半分程度であることから。
sen.e: This names derived from the fact that its length is about half that of actual collar.
This names derives from the fact that its length is about half of the actual collar.
sen.cmt: derived を derives に修正しました。that of actual collar を of the actual collar に修正しました。
sen.e: This names derives from the fact that its length is about half of the actual collar.

sen.j: 本来の目的は襦袢を埃、皮脂や整髪料から保護するもの（汚れたらはずして洗濯し、何度も使用する）であるが、顔に近い部位に身につけるものであることから着こなしのポイントとして重要視される。
sen.e: Although its main purpose is to shield juban from dusts, sebum and/or hairdressings (when it gets dirty, it is taken off, washed and repeatedly used), it is seen as the important point in dressing since it is put on at the site near the face.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Although its main purpose is to shield juban from dusts, sebum and/or hairdressings (when it gets dirty, you can take it off, wash it out and use it over and over), it is regarded as an important point in dressing since it is put on at the site near the face.
sen.cmt: when it gets dirty, it is taken off, washed and repeatedly used をwhen it gets dirty, you can take it off, wash it out and use it over and over に修正しました。 seen as the を regarded as an に修正しました。
sen.e: Although its main purpose is to shield juban from dusts, sebum and/or hairdressings (when it gets dirty, you can take it off, wash it out and use it over and over), it is regarded as an important point in dressing since it is put on at the site near the face.

sen.j: 刺繍などによる豪華な装飾を施した数十万円近い価格帯の半襟も存在する。
sen.e: Some products with embroidery decorations costs hundreds of thousands yen (several thousands dollars).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Some products with embroidery decorations cost hundreds of thousands yen (several thousand dollars).
sen.cmt: costs を cost に修正しました。several thousands を several thousand に修正しました。
sen.e: Some products with embroidery decorations cost hundreds of thousands yen (several thousand dollars).

sen.j: 半襟をも下着の一部と考えれば、その一部を見せるのが正式の着用法である点で、世界の民族衣装のなかでも例外的である。
sen.e: Being a kind of underwear, haneri is the unique one among various ethnic costumes in the world because a part of haneri falls into someone's eye when it is worn according to the formal way of wearing.
Taking it as a part of underwear, haneri is an exceptional one among various ethnic costumes in the world, because a part of haneri falls into someone's eye when it is formally dressed.
Taking it as a part of underwear, haneri is an exceptional one among various ethnic costumes in the world, because a part of haneri falls into someone's eye when it is formally dressed.

tit.cmt: Material を Materials に修正しました。

sen.j: 一般的には、縮緬はカジュアル、塩瀬羽二重はカジュアルから礼装まで広く使われる。
sen.e: Generally speaking, products of crepe are used for casual wafuku and products of shioze habutae (thick silk fabric) are used for a wide range of wafuku from casuals to formal dresses.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Generally speaking, products of crepe are used for casual wafuku and products of shioze habutae (thick silk fabric) are used for a wide range of casual and formal kimonos.
sen.cmt: casual wafuku を casual style に修正しました。wafuku from casuals to formal dresses をcasual and formal kimonos に修正しました。
sen.e: Generally speaking, crepe is used for casual wafuku, while shioze habutae (a, thick silk fabric) is used for a wide variety of wafuku, ranging from casual kimonos to formal kimonos.

sen.j: 普段着などには丈夫で汚れに強い木綿をあわせることも少なくない。
sen.e: Cotton, which is strong and stain-resistant, is often mixed with other fabric in the case of products for casual wafuku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Cotton, which is strong and stain-resistant, is often mixed with other fabric in the case of products for casual kimono.
sen.cmt: wafuku を kimono に修正しました。
sen.e: Cotton, which is strong and stain-resistant, is often mixed with other fabric in the case of products for casual kimono.

sen.j: 最近では、ポリエステルなども多く出回っている。
sen.e: Also, products of polyester have been on the market lately.
Also, products of polyester have been on the market lately.
Also, products of polyester have been on the market lately.

sen.j: 女性向けのものとしては、戦前は、色衿や刺繍衿が中心であったが、昭和15年に出た、奢侈品等製造販売制限規則をきっかけに白衿が流行した。
sen.e: Iroeri (colored haneri) or shishueri (haneri with embroidery) were mainly used by women during the pre-war period, but shiroeri (white haneri) became popular after "the regulation of the production and sale of luxury items" was established in 1940.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Before the World War II, iroeri (colored haneri) or shishueri (haneri with embroidery) were popular as women's haneri; however, shiroeri (white haneri) became popular after the Regulation of the Production and Sale of Luxury Items issued in 1940.

Before the World War II, iroeri (colored haneri) or shishueri (haneri with embroidery) were popular as women's haneri; however, shiroeri (white haneri) became popular after the Regulation of the Production and Sale of Luxury Items issued in 1940.

sen.j: 戦後になり色衿が若干復活するも、高度経済成長期の和服の脱・普段着化に伴い、ほとんど白衿一辺倒となった。
sen.e: Iroeri revived to a certain extent after the war, but shiroeri gradually became dominant because wafuku became little-used everyday clothes during the years of high economic growth.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Iroeri revived to a certain extent after the war, but shiroeri gradually became dominant because wafuku got less popular as everyday clothes in the high economic growth period.
sen.cmt: because 以下を全文修正しました。
sen.e: Iroeri revived to a certain extent after the war, but shiroeri gradually became dominant because wafuku got less popular as everyday clothes in the high economic growth period.

sen.j: 現在は、白以外にも、和服の色に合わせて赤、黄、青、緑、桃色、水色、紫など殆んど無数の色が存在する。
sen.e: Other than shiroeri, products of various colors, including red, yellow, blue, green, pink and purple, are being used at present depending on the color of wafuku.
Other than shiroeri, there are almost countless numbers of color for haneri, such as red, yellow, blue, green, pink and purple, according to the colors of wafuku.
sen.cmt: Other than shiroeri 以下を全文修正しました。
sen.e: Other than shiroeri, there are almost countless numbers of color for haneri, such as red, yellow, blue, green, pink and purple, according to the colors of wafuku.

sen.j: ただし、原則として赤い襟は少女向けとされるので、既婚女性は赤色やそれに近い色は避けたほうが無難とされている。
sen.e: However, as a red collar is regarded as the one for young girls in principle, it is advisable for married women not to use products of red or similar color.
However, since red collars are regarded for young girls in principle, it is better for married women to avoid those of red or similar colors.
sen.cmt: as a red collar 以下を全文修正しました。
sen.e: However, since red collars are regarded for young girls in principle, it is better for married women to avoid those of red or similar colors.

sen.j: 無地のもののほか、刺繍を施したものや刺繍に加えてビーズなどの装飾を加えたものもある。
sen.e: Other than plain haneri, those decorated with embroidery as well as those decorated with embroidery and beads are on the market.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Other than plain haneri, those decorated with embroidery or even with embroidery and beads are available.
sen.cmt: as well as 以下を全文修正しました。
sen.e: Other than plain haneri, those decorated with embroidery or even with embroidery and beads are available.

sen.j: 模様は季節に準じたものを使うのが大原則。
sen.e: Designs should be chosen, in principle, according to seasons.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Designs should be chosen, in principle, according to season.
sen.cmt: seasons を season に修正しました。
sen.e: Designs should be chosen, in principle, according to season.

sen.j: 男性向けのものは、粋好みの黒が最も多く、続いて上品な薄水色、灰色、茶色、深緑、藍など落ち着いた色合いのものが中心。
sen.e: Black haneri, which is favored by nifty men, are the main stream products for men, followed by those of refined and soft color such as light blue, grey, brown, deep green or indigo.
Black haneri, which is favored by nifty men, are the main stream products for men, followed by those of refined and soft color such as light blue, grey, brown, deep green or indigo.
Black haneri, which is favored by nifty men, are the main stream products for men, followed by those of refined and soft color such as light blue, grey, brown, deep green or indigo.

sen.j: 現在、黒紋付をはじめとする礼装には白無地が一般的だが、昭和初期までは男性の場合礼装にも薄水色か薄灰色を使うのが主流である。
sen.e: While solid white products are mainly used for formal dress such as kuromontsuki (black haori with family crest) at present, products of light blue or light grey were mainly used for men's formal dress until the early Showa era.

While solid white products are popular for formal dress such as kuromontsuki (black haori with family crest) at present, products of light blue or light grey were mainly used for men's formal dress until the early Showa period.
sen.cmt: mainly used を popular に修正しました。era を period に修正しました。
sen.e: While solid white products are popular for formal dress such as kuromontsuki (black haori with family crest) at present, products of light blue or light grey were mainly used for men's formal dress until the early Showa period.

sen.j: 現在は花柳界の言葉。
sen.e: Currently, this term is used only in karyukai (world of the geisha).
Currently, this term is used only in karyukai (world of the geisha).
Currently, this term is used only in karyukai (world of the geisha).

sen.j: 少女が掛ける赤い半襟から一人前の女性の白い半襟へ襟を掛け替える習慣を言い、半玉、舞妓などの雛妓が芸妓となることを指す。
sen.e: It means the practice of changing red haneri of young girls for white haneri of adult women, and in karyukai, it refers the promotion from hinakko, such as hangyoku (child geisha) and maiko (apprentice geisha), to geigi (geisha).

It means the practice of changing red haneri of young girls for white haneri of adult women, and in karyukai, it refers the promotion from hinakko, such as hangyoku (child geisha) and maiko (apprentice geisha), to geigi (geisha).

It means the practice of changing red haneri of young girls for white haneri of adult women, and in karyukai, it refers the promotion from hinakko, such as hangyoku (child geisha) and maiko (apprentice geisha), to geigi (geisha).

sen.j: 半玉はこのときから一人前の玉代を受け取ることが出来、髪形なども変える。
sen.e: From that time, hangyoku is allowed to receive gyokudai (fee for geisha) at the full rate, and she changes hairstyle etc.
From that time, hangyoku is allowed to receive gyokudai (fee for geisha) at the full rate, and she changes her hairstyle etc.
sen.cmt: hairstyle を her hairstyle に修正しました。
sen.e: From that time, hangyoku is allowed to receive gyokudai (fee for geisha) at the full rate, and she changes her hairstyle etc.

sen.j: 襟替え前の雛妓を赤襟とも言う。
sen.e: Hinakko before erigae is also called akaeri (red collar).
Hinakko before erigae is also called "akaeri" (red collar).
sen.cmt: akaeri にダブルコーテーションを追記しました。
sen.e: Hinakko before erigae is also called "akaeri" (red collar).
